## Import Recipe from URL

Paste a recipe URL below to import it into DormChef. We support most major recipe sites and blogs that include structured recipe data.

<div class="import-section">
  <form id="import-recipe-form" class="import-form">

      <label for="recipe-url-input">Recipe URL</label>
      <input
        type="url"
        id="recipe-url-input"
        name="url"
        placeholder="https://example.com/recipe"
        required
      />
    </div>
    <button type="submit">Import Recipe</button>
  </form>

  <div id="import-result"></div>
</div>

<script type="module">
  import { initRecipeImport } from './assets/js/recipe-import.js';

## How It Works

1. **Paste URL** - Enter the URL of any recipe page from popular recipe sites
2. **Preview** - We'll extract the recipe data and show you a preview
3. **Save** - Optionally save the recipe to your DormChef collection

### Supported Sites

Our importer works with sites that use structured data (JSON-LD, Microdata), including:

- AllRecipes
- Food Network
- Bon App√©tit
- NYT Cooking
- Serious Eats
- And many food blogs with Schema.org recipe markup

### What Gets Imported

- Recipe title and description
- Ingredients list with quantities
- Step-by-step instructions
- Cooking time and servings
- Recipe images
- Nutrition information (when available)
